active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate whether penetration testing alone is sufficient to comply with GDPR Article 32, or if additional measures like DPIA are always necessary. Support arguments with real-world breach examples (e.g., British Airways 2018 fine for inadequate security measures) and reference ICO guidance.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains the DPIA process and when it is mandatory under GDPR Article 35 (e.g., high-risk processing), while the other quizzes them on triggers and outputs; then switch roles and incorporate Article 32 TOMs into the explanation.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a mock e-commerce site handling EU customer data, design a pentest plan targeting GDPR compliance vulnerabilities (e.g., weak encryption, untested resilience). Include scoping, methodology (e.g., OWASP testing for access controls), reporting to a fictional Data Protection Officer, and remediation recommendations.

additional_activities.activity: Role-play: Act as an ethical hacker presenting GDPR pentest findings to a Data Protection Officer, justifying non-compliance risks.
Think-pair-share: Discuss common misconceptions (e.g., 'GDPR only applies to EU companies') and correct them with evidence from research context.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in GDPR Data Protection Testing (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Penetration Testing Types > 005_Compliance-Driven Testing Categories > Industry-Specific Compliance Testing > GDPR Data Protection Testing). Generate 75 high-quality flashcards using the exact schema provided. Incorporate: - Research context: GDPR (EU personal data regulation, rights like access/erasure); personal data; TOMs from Article 32 (pseudonymisation/encryption; confidentiality/integrity/availability/resilience; restore availability; regular testing/evaluation; process minimisation); DPIA (Article 35); pentesting for compliance (rhinosecuritylabs.com, ico.org.uk, eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32016R0679). - Voter consensus: Full TOMs list; real-world cases; prerequisites from basic pentesting. - Pedagogy: Objectives [insert learning_objectives array]; Scaffolding [insert scaffolding object]; Active learning [insert active_learning object]. - Best practices: Active recall, spaced repetition; distractors from misconceptions. Distribute cards: 20% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 30% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4. Ensure Bloom's progression. Output ONLY valid JSON array per flashcard_schema.output_format. No extra text.
